Define average number of newborn children per adult bear in Cedar Valley as n; k = S = 3; so n = 2 + k = 2 + 3 = 5. Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in Cedar Valley as C; P = m = 12; so C = 2 * P = 2 * 12 = 24. Define adult bear in Cedar Valley as p; so p = n = 5. Define adult racoon in Cedar Valley as f; i = n = 5; so f = 2 + i = 2 + 5 = 7. Define total number of newborn animal children in Cedar Valley as e; W = m * E = 12 * 3 = 36; r = p * n = 5 * 5 = 25; d = f * C = 7 * 24 = 168; R = W + r = 36 + 25 = 61; e = R + d = 61 + 168 = 229. Answer: 229.

question: What is the average number of teachers per elementary school in Ruby Bay?
solution: Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Oakbridge City as T; so T = 3. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Shoreline City as v; N = T = 3; so v = 2 * N = 2 * 3 = 6. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Oakbridge City as K; so K = 2. Define public highschool in Oakbridge City as G; C = K = 2; so G = 4 * C = 4 * 2 = 8. Define regional medical school in Oakbridge City as X; p = v = 6; so X = 2 * p = 2 * 6 = 12. Define elementary school in Oakbridge City as o; so o = v - T = 6 - 3 = 3. Define total number of schools in Oakbridge City as V; z = G + o = 8 + 3 = 11; so V = z + X = 11 + 12 = 23. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Ruby Bay as L; n = V = 23; so L = 4 * n = 4 * 23 = 92. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Ruby Bay as i; so i = L - X = 92 - 12 = 80. Answer: 80.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define public highschool in Evervale City as V; so V = 2. Define total number of schools in Evervale City as G; so G = V = 2. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Evervale City as s; H = G = 2; so s = 2 * H = (2) * (2) = 4. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Evervale City as U; so U = V * s = (2) * (4) = 8. Define private middle school in Glenfield City as N; q = U = 8; so N = 1 + q = 1 + 8 = 9. Define culinarian school in Glenfield City as D; so D = N = 9. Define total number of schools in Glenfield City as p; so p = D + N = 9 + 9 = 18. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Glenfield City as f; so f = p = 18. Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Glenfield City as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Glenfield City as Y; P = D * x = (9) * (x) = 9*x; d = N * f = (9) * (18) = 162; Y = P + d = 9*x + 162 = 9*x + 162. We know Y = 198, so we have 9*x + 162 = 198 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 9*x + 162 = 198. Move all terms to one side: 9*x - 36 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 9*x = 36. Divide both sides by 9: x = 36 / 9. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Evervale City as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define culinarian school in Hawkesbury as V; so V = x = x. Define culinarian school in Evervale City as y; A = V = x; so y = 3 + A = 3 + x = x + 3. Define culinarian school in Brightford as p; so p = y - V = (x + 3) - (x) = 3. Define regional medical school in Evervale City as W; so W = p - V = (3) - (x) = 3 - x. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Hawkesbury as B; so B = W = 3 - x. Define elementary school in Evervale City as T; v = B = 3 - x; so T = 4 * v = (4) * (3 - x) = 12 - 4*x. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Hawkesbury as f; so f = T = 12 - 4*x. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Brightford as N; S = f = 12 - 4*x; so N = 4 * S = (4) * (12 - 4*x) = 48 - 16*x. Define private middle school in Evervale City as L; F = N + B = 48 - 16*x + 3 - x = 51 - 17*x; so L = 3 * F = (3) * (51 - 17*x) = 153 - 51*x. We know L = 102, so we have 153 - 51*x = 102 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 153 - 51*x = 102. Move all terms to one side: 51 - 51*x = 0. Isolate the term with x: -51*x = -51. Divide both sides by -51: x = -51 / -51. Solution: x = 1. Answer: 1.
